Detailed Description

Class FaceGeometry manages the mapping between the AMR index space and the face-centered geometry index space. It is a subclass of hier::BoxGeometry and it computes intersections between face- centered box geometries for communication operations.

See header file for FaceData<TYPE> class for a more detailed description of the data layout.

See also:
hier::BoxGeometry
pdat::FaceOverlap

Construct the face geometry object given an AMR index space box and ghost cell width.

Precondition:
box.getDim() == ghosts.getDim()
ghosts.min() >= 0

Member Function Documentation

hier::Box SAMRAI::pdat::FaceGeometry::toFaceBox ( const hier::Box &  box,
tbox::Dimension::dir_t  face_normal 
) [static]

Convert an AMR index box space box into an face geometry box. An face geometry box extends the given AMR index box space box by one in upper end for the face normal coordinate direction.

Recall that box indices are cyclically shifted such that the face normal direction is the first coordinate index. See SideData header file.

Precondition:
(face_normal >= 0) && (face_normal < box.getDim().getValue())

void SAMRAI::pdat::FaceGeometry::transform ( hier::Box &  box,
int &  normal_direction,
const hier::Transformation &  transformation 
) [static]

Transform a face-centered box.

At input, the Box is assumed to represent an face-centered box with the given normal direction. The Box will be transformed according to the coordinate system transformation defined by the Transformation object. At output, normal_direction will represent the output box's new normal direction.

Parameters:
[in,out] box 
[in,out] normal_direction 
[in] transformation
